author: Staff Reporter
text:
Lead Bank has sent communication to all banks in the districts asking them to keep full documentary evidences for the cash that were either been transported from a branch to another branch or from the chest branch to the ATMs.

The direction was given following the interception of a vehicle carrying Rs. 26 lakh from a chest branch of a bank to fill the ATMs, by the election officials here on Tuesday night. The amount was later released.

“The banks have now been asked to carry cash only in ‘cash vans’ as far as possible with proper authorisation letter issued by the branch to release the amount meant to be loaded into various ATMs. If the cash transaction is between the banks, necessary documents for the transfer should be carried by the officials travelling in the van.

“The registration number of the vehicle used for transportation need to be mentioned in authorisation letter”, said Lead Bank sources.

The officials and security guard travelling in the cash vans were asked to wear identity cards.
title: Lead Bank issues directives to banks
